Step I. Feature Extraction

Source: vignettes/step1.Rmd
step1.Rmd

In step I, we use the petler.fpca function to perform a functional PCA (Wu et al. 2013), which is used to estimate the mean density functions (and covariance functions) using longitudinal encounter data.

library(PETLER)
## Loading required package: survival
system.time(obj <- petler.fpca(data_org))
##    user  system elapsed 
##  79.358  19.671  54.616
saveRDS(obj, "step1.rds") # save results for step II

Estimated Mean Density

Subject-Specific Densities

The estimated mean density functions (and covariance functions) from FPCA are then used to obtain subject-specific densities, from which features will be extracted.

Feature Extraction

Important features from subject-specific densities and FPCA may include:

  • first code time (1stCode)

  • peak time (Pk)

  • change point time (ChP)

  • first functional PC score (1stScore)

  • log of total number of codes (logN)

head(obj$ValidFt[, 1:5])
##       1stCode1       Pk1       ChP1  1stScore1    logN1
## 90001  9.00000 50.383819  5.7376591 -0.3877255 1.386294
## 90002 70.37372 70.373717 70.3737166 -0.1452653 0.000000
## 90003  5.00000  7.100616  4.2229979  0.6688311 2.708050
## 90004 33.80698 33.806982 33.8069815 -0.1452653 0.000000
## 90005 98.62834 98.628337 98.6283368 -0.1452653 0.000000
## 90006  1.00000  1.144641  0.2641478 -0.2494385 1.386294

##       1stCode2       Pk2      ChP2  1stScore2     logN2

## 90002 21.00000 15.482218  5.805832 -0.4044147 1.0986123
## 90003  1.00000  9.043943  7.250103 -0.4905999 1.3862944
## 90004 33.80698 33.806982 33.806982 -0.8923211 0.0000000

## 90006 17.60986 17.609856 17.609856 -0.8923211 0.0000000

## 90002 70.37372 70.37372 70.37372  1.894450 0.0000000

The extracted features are saved in step1.rds and will be used in step II of the PETLER algorithm.
